page.title: 09THE CARDIOTHORACIC INSTITUTE
page.content: {The Cardiothoracic Institute,}a centre for scientific research in cardio- pulmonary medicine, was founded in 1970 and is funded by a charitable trust. Situated in the grounds of the King Edward VII Hospital,it provides extensive research facilities directed principally to the clinical investigation of cardio-pulmonary disease. An important part of the work is directed to the needs of the community and clinical care is given in conjunction with the hospital. The Institute is concerned with the social impact of disease on the community, its effect on the individual, on specific organs, tissues, cells and subcellular components. Services provided include acute coronary care, continuing care for carcinoma as well as internal medicine with an emphasis on cardio-pulmonary disease.
